thread.title: Ivanka Trump Accompanies Her Father to Honor Navy SEAL Killed During First Trump Raid
thread.title_full: Ivanka Trump Accompanies Her Father to Honor Navy SEAL Killed During First Trump Raid

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Ivanka Trump Accompanies Her Father to Honor Navy SEAL Killed During First Trump Raid
text:
President Donald Trump and his daughter Ivanka Trump made an unannounced trip to Delaware's Dover Air Force Base on Wednesday to honor the remains of the U.S. Navy SEAL who was killed during a weekend raid on al Qaeda militants in Yemen.
Chief Special Warfare Operator William "Ryan" Owens, 36, was the first known military casualty since Trump took office. The Navy SEAL was one of about 30 killed during the raid last weekend, including 14 militants and multiple woman and children. The 8-year-old American daughter of Anwar al-Awlaki, who was killed in a 2011 drone strike, was also killed during the raid. The Associated Press reports three other U.S. service members were wounded during the attack.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Multiple sources report that the raid was originally planned by former President Barack Obama's administration, but was only authorized after Trump took office. NBC reports a military official revealed "almost everything went wrong" with the raid, and that Defense Secretary James Mattis had to excuse himself from Washington's Alfalfa Club Dinner "to deal with the repercussions."
According to Reuters , military officials stated that there were many issues with the raid, including the fact that Trump allegedly approved the operation "without sufficient intelligence":
U.S. military officials told Reuters that Trump approved his first covert counterterrorism operation without sufficient intelligence , ground support or adequate backup preparations. As a result, three officials said , the attacking SEAL team found itself dropping onto a reinforced al Qaeda base defended by landmines, snipers, and a larger than expected contingent of heavily armed Islamist extremists. Trump's trip to Delaware on Wednesday was originally top secret, and he reportedly only allowed a select group of journalists to go with him on the condition that they did not reveal where he was until after he arrived. The president later spent a couple hours with Owens' family at the base.
"I just returned from an amazing visit with a great, great family at Dover," he said later that day while swearing in Rex Tillerson as Secretary of State. "It is something very sad, very beautiful. Ryan, a great man."
Additional reporting from The Associated Press.
Follow Gina on Twitter .
